subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: New Zealand dialect
msgSnippet: My post was not meant to deter anyone from continuing to improve QS and its utility for all English speakers.  I have been advocating QS for decades now.  You
messageBody:
My post was not meant to deter anyone from continuing to improve QS and its utility for all English speakers.  I have been advocating QS for decades now.  You cannot imagine how pleased I am to see these new proposals and work being done.  We have had what previously would have been a year's total of messages sent in the last few weeks.  Very exciting!

I have been writing QS so long, that I forgot, or, perhaps, didn't understand, that what seems second nature to me may not be so obvious to a newbie with no experience in phonemic writing.

Paige

Anthony Grahn wrote:

--- In Read_Alphabet@ yahoogroups. com, "C. Paige Gabhart"


  ... phonemic QS may be serviceable but lexical set QS may work even better.

The current exercise may have started with "how do you spell 'air'"
but has now become an opportunity to allow very modern linguistic
techniques to be brought to the Read Alphabet. And if the participants
are new to QS, I think their knowledge of linguistics is world class.
What might be being built by the participants as a mere hobby and
break from work could be on par with a real work of academia. I'm more
than happy to aid in anyway my humble skills and finite time allow.
